nlacp: The system retrieves and displays the Student’s current schedule (e.g., the schedule for the current semester).
The system cancels the course offering for each schedule that contains it.
The system requests that the Registrar specify the function he or she would like to perform (either Add a Student, Update a Student, or Delete a Student)

The Professor can either resolve the schedule conflict (i.e., by canceling his selection to teach one of the course offerings), or cancel the operation, in which case, any selections will be lost, and the use case ends.
They will also need to see which students signed up for their course offerings.
If no alternates are available, then no substitution will be made.
The Student also selects any course offerings to delete from the existing schedule.
If a course offering becomes full while a student is building a schedule including that offering, the student must be notified.

truth.subject: none
truth.condition: course offering becomes full while a student is building a schedule including that offering

policy.subject: none
policy.condition: course offering becomes full while a student is building a schedule including that offering

nlacp: Only Professors can enter grades for students.
The professor selects possibly and possibly de-selects the course offerings that he or she wishes to teach for the upcoming semester.
The professor is added to the system.
The Student selects 4 primary course offerings and 2 alternate course offerings from the list of available offerings.
This use case allows the Registrar to maintain student information in the registration system.
The Student verifies the deletion.
If, in the Update a Professor  or Delete a Professor sub-flows, a professor with the specified id number does not exist, the system displays an error message.

truth.subject: system
truth.condition: professor with the specified id number does not exist in the update a professor or delete a professor subflow

policy.subject: system
policy.condition: professor with the specified id number does not exist in the update a professor or delete a professor subflows

nlacp: Professors will be able to access the system to sign up to teach courses as well as record grades.
If, in the Update a Student  or Delete a Student  sub-flows, a student with the specified id number does not exist, the system displays an error message.

truth.subject: system
truth.condition: in the update a student or delete a student subflows, a student with the specified id number does not exist

policy.subject: system
policy.condition: in the update a student or delete a student subflows, a student with the specified id number does not exist

nlacp: If, in the Delete A Professor sub-flow, the Registrar decides not to delete the professor, the delete is cancelled, and the Basic Flow is re-started at the beginning.

truth.subject: none
truth.condition: in the delete a professor subflow the registrar decides not to delete the professor the delete is cancelled

policy.subject: registrar
policy.condition: in the delete a professor subflow the registrar decides not to delete the professor the delete is cancelled

nlacp: For each selected course offering on the schedule not already marked as “enrolled in”, the system verifies that the Student has the necessary prerequisites, that the course offering is open, and that there are no schedule conflicts.
If, in the Update a Schedule or Delete a Schedule sub-flows, the system is unable to retrieve the Student’s schedule, an error message is displayed.

truth.subject: none
truth.condition: in the update a schedule or delete a schedule subflows the system is unable to retrieve the students schedule

policy.subject: system
policy.condition: in the update a schedule or delete a schedule subflows the system is unable to retrieve the students schedule

nlacp: The system requests that the Registrar enter the professor id
At the end of the semester, the student will be able to access the system to view an electronic report card.
The system requests that the Registrar enter the student id.
For each student on the list, the Professor enters a grade: A, B, C, D, F, or I.  The system records the student’s grade for the course offering.
The system deletes the student from the system.
In addition, each student will indicate two alternative choices in case the student cannot be assigned to a primary selection.

truth.subject: student
truth.condition: student cannot be assigned to a primary selection

policy.subject: student
policy.condition: student cannot be assigned to a primary selection

nlacp: The system displays a list of course offerings the Professor taught in the previous semester.
The Registrar can then enter a different id number or cancel the operation, at which point the use case ends.
If there is no conflict, the system updates the course offering information for each offering the professor selects (i.e., records the professor as the instructor for the course offering).

The Student can either select a different course offering and the use case continues, save the schedule, as is (see Save a Schedule subflow), or cancel the operation, at which point the Basic Flow is re-started at the beginning.
If, in the Basic Flow, the professor is not eligible to teach any course offerings in the upcoming semester, the system will display an error message.

truth.subject: system
truth.condition: in the basic flow the professor is not eligible to teach any course offerings in the upcoming semester

policy.subject: system
policy.condition: in the basic flow the professor is not eligible to teach any course offerings in the upcoming semester

nlacp: The system requests that the Registrar enter the professor information.
This use case allows a Professor to submit student grades for one or more classes completed in the previous semester.
If the Professor wishes to skip a particular student, the grade information can be left blank and filled in at a later time.

truth.subject: professor
truth.condition: professor wishes to skip a particular student

truth.subject: professor
truth.condition: professor wishes to skip a particular student

policy.subject: professor
policy.condition: professor wishes to skip a particular student

nlacp: Once the registration process is completed for a student, the registration system sends information to the billing system so the student can be billed for the semester.

truth.subject: registration system
truth.condition: registration process is completed for a student
truth.purpose: student can be billed for the semester

policy.subject: registration system
policy.condition: registration process is completed for a student
policy.purpose: student can be billed for the semester

nlacp: The Professor selects a course offering.
The system also retrieves and displays the list of courses the professor has previously selected to teach.

If, in the Submit Schedule sub-flow, the system determines that the Student has not satisfied the necessary prerequisites, or that the selected course offering is full, or that there are schedule conflicts, an error message is displayed.

truth.subject: none
truth.condition: in the submit schedule subflow the system determines that the student has not satisfied the necessary prerequisites or that the selected course offering is full or that there are schedule conflict

policy.subject: system
policy.condition: in the submit schedule subflow the system determines that the student has not satisfied the necessary prerequisites or that the selected course offering is full or that there are schedule conflicts

nlacp: The system retrieves and displays the student information.
If, in the Delete A Student  sub-flow, the Registrar decides not to delete the student, the delete is cancelled and the Basic Flow is re-started at the beginning.

truth.subject: none
truth.condition: in the delete a student subflow the registrar decides not to delete the student

truth.subject: none
truth.condition: in the delete a student subflow the registrar decides not to delete the student

policy.subject: registrar
policy.condition: in the delete a student subflow the registrar decides not to delete the student

nlacp: The system displays each student and any grade that was previously assigned for the offering.
If the use case was successful, student grades for a course offering are updated.
The system removes the professor from teaching the de-selected course offerings.
The system prompts the Registrar to confirm the deletion of the professor.

policy.subject: system
policy.purpose: confirm the deletion of the professor

nlacp: If the use case was successful, the student schedule is created, updated, or deleted.
The system provides the Registrar with the new professor id.
The system provides the Registrar with the new student id.
The Professor may also change the grade for a student by entering a new grade.
The Student may update the course selections on the current selection by deleting and adding new course offerings.
This use case allows a Student to register for course offerings in the current semester.
Once the Registrar updates the necessary information, the system updates the student information.
Only the Registrar is allowed to change any student information.
The Registrar verifies the deletion.
The system deletes the professor from the system.
The Student acknowledges the error, and the Basic Flow is re- started at the beginning.
The system must prevent students from changing any schedules other than their own, and professors from modifying assigned course offerings for other professors.
For each semester, there is a period of time that students can change their schedule.
Once the student has made his or her selections, the system updates the schedule for the Student using the selected course offerings.

truth.subject: system
truth.condition: student has made his or her selection

policy.subject: system
policy.condition: student has made his or her selections

nlacp: When the use case starts, if it is determined that registration for the current semester has been closed, a message is displayed to the Student, and the use case terminates.

truth.condition: it is determined that registration for the current semester has been closed

truth.subject: none
truth.condition: it is determined that registration for the current semester has been closed

policy.subject: none
policy.condition: it is determined that registration for the current semester has been closed

nlacp: This use case allows a Student to view his or her report card for the previously completed semester.
The student is added to the system.
This use case allows the Registrar to maintain professor information in the registration system.
The system requests that the Registrar enter the student information.
If so, the system commits the course offering for each schedule that contains it.
Once the Registrar updates the necessary information, the system updates the professor record.
If it is, then a message is displayed to the Registrar, and the use case terminates.
The system calculates the tuition owed by each student for his current semester schedule and sends a transaction to the Billing System.
The Student can also update or delete course selections if changes are made within the add or drop period at the beginning of the semester.

truth.subject: student
truth.condition: changes are made within the add or drop period at the beginning of the semester

truth.condition: changes are made within the add or drop period at the beginning of the semester

policy.subject: student

policy.condition: changes are made within the add or drop period at the beginning of the semester

nlacp: Professors cannot change the course offerings they teach after registration for the current semester has been closed.

truth.subject: professor
truth.condition: registration for the current semester has been closed

policy.subject: professors
policy.condition: registration for the current semester has been closed

nlacp: At the beginning of each semester, students may request a course catalogue containing a list of course offerings for the semester.
If, in the Basic Flow, the system cannot find any grade information from the previous semester for the Student, a message is displayed.

truth.condition: in the basic flow the system cannot find any grade information from the previous semester for the student

policy.subject: system
policy.condition: in the basic flow the system cannot find any grade information from the previous semester for the student

nlacp: The system requests that the Registrar enter the professor id.
In addition, the professors will be able to record the grades for the students in each class.
The system retrieves a list of all students who were registered for the course offering.
This use case starts when the Registrar wishes to add, change, possibly and possibly delete student information in the system.
The Registrar enters the professor id.
This use case allows a Registrar to close the registration process.
If the use case was successful, the professor information is added, updated, or deleted from the system.
The system retrieves and displays the list of course offerings the professor is eligible to teach for the current semester.
The system requests that the Registrar enter the student id
The system retrieves and displays the grade information for each of the course offerings the Student completed during the previous semester.
The system verifies that the selected offerings do not conflict (i.e., have the same dates and times) with each other or any course offerings that the professor has previously signed up to teach.
The Student selects the course offerings to add from the list of available course offerings.
The system will also indicate which are the conflicting courses.
When the use case starts, if it is determined that registration for the current semester has been closed, a message is displayed to the Professor, and the use case terminates.

truth.condition: it is determined that registration for the current semester has been closed

truth.subject: none
truth.condition: it is determined that registration for the current semester has been closed

policy.subject: none
policy.condition: it is determined that registration for the current semester has been closed

nlacp: This use case allows a Professor to select the course offerings from the course catalog for the courses that he or she is eligible for and wishes to teach in the upcoming semester.
The system then adds the Student to the selected course offering.
If the schedule contains “enrolled in” course offerings, the Student must be removed from the course offering.

truth.condition: schedule contains enrolled in course offering

policy.subject: none
policy.condition: schedule contains enrolled in course offerings

nlacp: This includes adding, modifying, and deleting professors from the system.
The Registrar makes the desired changes to the professor information.
The system retrieves a list of available course offerings from the Course Catalog System and displays the list to the Student.
Professors must be able to access the on-line system to indicate which courses they will be teaching.

nlacp: The system retrieves and displays the professor information.
Students must be able to access the system during this time to add or drop courses.
The system deletes the Schedule.
For each course offering, the system closes all course offerings.
The Close Registration processing cannot be performed if registration is in progress.
The Registrar makes the desired changes to the student information.
The Registrar enters the student id.
The Billing System will send the bill to the students, which will include a copy of their final schedule.
Once the student has made his or her selections, the system creates a schedule for the Student containing the selected course offerings.

nlacp: The Student acknowledges the error message, and the use case terminates.
If the course offerings do not have at least three students at this point (some may have been added as a result of leveling), then the system cancels the course offering.
